string_table.string: To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.
Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
You must complete the question before submitting.
Enter your name in the field below:
You have reached the time limit set for the quiz. Press 'OK' to continue.

slidelink.displaytext: Look at the program below. Select all statements that would be appropriate to place at line 90 so the program stops or ends correctly after handling the number is zero case.
Drag the program lines into the correct order to show how the GOTO statement works.
Select all the correct IFTHEN statements.
Match each line of code with its correct purpose.
Drag the correct word into each blank to complete the QBASIC program. 10 PRINT "Enter a positive number:" 20 INPUT N 30 IF N < 0 THEN 40 PRINT "Valid number: "; N 50 END
Drag the statements into the correct order to form a valid QBASIC program that uses STOP and END correctly.
Hands-On Activity: Pseudo Code for Multiples
Calculator to calculate multiple of number
Calculator to calculate multiple of number
Generating LCM of two numbers with QBASIC
Video 2: Least Common Multiples with QBASIC
Arrange the steps in the correct order to find HCF using prime factorization.
Which of the following numbers are common factors of 24 and 36? (Select all that apply.)
The HCF of two or more numbers is the ______ number that divides them ______ without any ______.
Drag the correct HCF to each number pair.
Match the QBASIC Code Line to Its Purpose
GeneratingHCF of Three numbers with QBASIC
Q11. Match the QBASIC command to its function
Q12. Classify the following as LCM or HCF problems
Q1: Which of the following best describes a multiple of a number?
Q2: What are the first four multiples of 6?
Q3: Which of the following numbers is a multiple of both 4 and 6?
Q4: The Least Common Multiple (LCM) of 8 and 12 is:
Q5: Which method can be used to find LCM efficiently?
Q6:The Highest Common Factor (HCF) of 18 and 24 is:
Q7:Which of the following best defines HCF?
Q8. Which QBASIC keyword is used to display output on the screen?
Q9. Which QBASIC statement is used to repeat instructions?
Q10. Which of the following is a correct QBASIC statement?
Q13. A student wants to calculate the HCF of two numbers using QBASIC. Which concept is most important?
Q14. Which QBASIC statement allows the user to enter a number?
Q15. Which QBASIC line is missing in this loop?
Q16:What will be the output of the following QBASIC code?
Q17: Every whole number has an infinite number of __________.
Q18: The LCM of two numbers is the __________ common multiple.
Q18: The LCM of two numbers is the __________ common multiple.
Q19:Drag and Drop all the multiples of 9 in the right box.
Q20:Which of the following statements are TRUE?
